# Variable Crimes - These crimes can vary in severity and have scaling punishments.
Charge
Description
Minor
Major
Damage to UNMC Property
Damaging the ship or making any unauthorized modifications to it as outlined in Standard Operating Procedure.\nMaterials for repairs should be taken from maintenance storages.
Breaking a window, damaging a wall, etc.\n[bold]Return the ship to it's exact previous state, or serve 7.5 minutes if not possible.[/bold]
Breaking the law in a major manner includes breaking /dismantling walls or several windows.\n[bold]10 minutes.[/bold]
Insubordination
Failing to follow a lawful order from a superior person of rank or position, or disrespecting someone of a higher rank or position.\nDisrespecting an [bold]Officer[/bold] is charged as [bold]Disrespecting a Superior Officer[/bold] and is under [textlink="Minor Crimes" link="RMCMarineLawCrimesMinor"]. \n[italic]This does not apply to orders made to a person with intent to arrest, which instead would be [bold]Resisting Arrest[/bold][/italic]
Failing to follow an order which is not personally directed.\n\nOR\n\nDisrespecting someone of a higher rank or position.\n[bold]7.5 minutes.[/bold]
Failing to follow an order personally directed at a person in question using either their name or clearly communicating its meant for them.\n[bold]15 minutes.[/bold]
Interference
Interfering in a legal arrest being performed.
Interfering without ill intent, such as blocking the way or helping someone up.\n[bold]7.5 minutes.[/bold]
Interfering with ill intent or in a clear way to hinder the arrest being performed.\n[bold]15 minutes.[/bold]
Unauthorized use of Listening Devices
The use of listening devices in violation of Standard Operating Procedures.
Illegally placing a listening device in a public area such as the gym.\n[bold]7.5 minutes.[/bold]
Illegally placing a listening device in a secure area, or area with privacy shutters, such as CIC or the CL's office.\n[italic]If the listening device is also tied to a foreign government or terror organisation this is additionally considered Subterfuge[/italic].\n[bold]15 minutes.[/bold]
Resisting Arrest
To resist a lawful arrest or search by a Military Police officer.
Refusing to comply with a lawful search or arrest.\n[bold]5 minutes.[/bold]
Resisting a legal arrest by an MP by fleeing or using force.\n[bold]10 minutes.[/bold]
Aiding and Abetting
Assisting others in committing a crime, directly or indirectly, or encouraging them to commit one. Any person Aiding and Abetting is required to be told the crimes of the person they aided.
[bold]Same punishment as crime committed.[/bold]
[bold]Same punishment as crime committed.[/bold]
Disorderly Conduct in Confinement
To cause disruption in a significant manner while in Brig and under arrest. This can be added on to any charge.
Breaking a Minor Law while under arrest or in Prison.\n[bold]7.5 minutes.[/bold]
Breaking a Major Law while under arrest or in Prison.[bold]15 minutes.[/bold]
